text: I am migrating one to another portal.
<@U034X9K26MD> thanks! Was looking all over for this. Wish it’d get moved to the updated docs.

Hello, team.
I'm trying to authorize the app in a HubSpot developer account, I've done everything according to the documentation:
1. created a redirect link
2. authorized the app
3. got the link with the code

But when I try to authorize the received token through the API I get an error:
Status code 400
{"status":"error","message":"The access token must have the correct format","correlationId":"d051cf14-3e2d-4b4d-b4fa-886c2bd36612"}
What could be the problem?
Thanks in advance
Did you set the access token as a Bearer token, in the auth header of your request?
yes
Thanks a lot, <@U038DUUV3GE> !

Hi <@U03BA1PRV7S> thanks for your reply...but i think that this is the problem , I did not find a way to subscribe the engagements to be heard by the webhooks and what seemed strangest to me is not seeing the evolution in API versions v3/v4 something that I can do an incremental query , it seems that we are running out of resources for consuming this information and I don't know where to go next

Hi everyone :wave:

I want to export in a CSV file some basic contact information: contact.first_name, contact.last_name, contact.email through HubSpot API (sandbox account and private app) using this endpoint `POST */crm/v3/exports/export/async*`  documented here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/exports>

I've selected *all scopes* for my private app (including *crm.export*).
I'm getting an undocumented error:  `Public Exports API is gated for this portal`

I'm getting the same error when running the request in the documentation webpage using the "test call" button.
Is there any configuration that needs to be done on the account to make this request succcess ?
```{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "Public Exports API is gated for this portal",
  "correlationId": "37e96a70-e713-4086-aeac-cffe5824dcbe",
  "category": "MISSING_PERMISSIONS"
}```

No I was talking about triggering the CRM card function, you definitely can but it seems super redundant because the only things that can trigger those functions is the HubSpot ui when someone clicks a button
I've actually never seen this error before
Did you use the OAuth NodeJS github to setup the connection?
Currently this API is in Beta and you'll need to ask the PM running the beta to give your app the permissions to use that scope
<@U87NGNETZ> is this correct? if so can you authorize a private app?
PM?
Nevermind it looks like if you enroll yourself in the beta the option with pull up in the scopes menu
<@U04K7QXBM7T> Product Manager
Do you have that scope selected <@U04K7QXBM7T>

crm.export is on
This option is already avaible and checked for my private app
Very interesting

I think the Make solution above can solve your issue. I can check for the specific triggers that you need if you want me to and send you the data that is returned. We use it to log certain engagements in our database :slightly_smiling_face:.
Hmmm maybe I didn't understand well so the solution you proposed, where would be the trigger? if not for the webhook would it be for the custom workflow?
The trigger is the Make scenario itself. It will track all engagements in the account.

Right, today I extract the engagements, I would like to change this to a simpler extraction, today I do this extraction once a day, my trigger is a polling query, how do you suggest this solution be applied?

You could just set up the Watcher in Make and every X amount of time sync all that data to a G.Sheets. You can add filters too and other actions based on the engagements data like email subject, task name, etc etc... You can basically do whatever you want
But if you just want to log data you can create a google scheduled function too + many many other alternaties. Make would be the best option if you want to do more than just extract the data
Did you trade the code received in step 3 for an access token using the `<https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token>` endpoint?

howdy - running across an interesting quirk with the bulk import API (happy to file a report somewhere if that helps). If you include mapping in your JSON file that doesn’t end up being used (that data isn’t in the import file), the API gets off by a column and tries to import everything after that in the JSON file. So if there’s a definition in the JSON file and there’s nothing in your spreadsheet that matches that, everything beneath that in the JSON file gets imported into the wrong column and it causes a bunch of import errors. Easy enough to fix, but seems like an unused mapping should just get ignored.
Yeah, it's not super well documented but the column headers don't do anything
It's all based on column positions
so your first mapping is the first column, and your second mapping is the second column even if you tell it to do the third column
oh interesting. We had it that way by chance, but that makes sense based on this error
Yeah definitely something that HubSpot doesn't say but I think is true for all file types, I was just trying CSV when I found this out
